page.title: 07Government, Faceby
page.content: The area lies within the boundaries of {Hambleton District Council.}The North Yorkshire Moors National Park Planning Authority is the ruling body within the Park boundary, ie, south of the A172. Whorlton and Carlton each have 5 elected councillors. Faceby has only an annual parish meeting. Councils deal with planning matters, public footpaths and general maintenance of village services. These include weekly refuse collection, upkeep of highways and verges, and local sewage disosal (some houses still have septic tanks). {The Northumbrian Water Authority} provides supplies from hill springs and is responsible for Faceby Beck. {The North Eastern Electricity Board} provides power. There is no domestic gas supply but the high-pressure main passes just north of the area. There is no resident{policeman.}
